column1: Knowledge [      /4]
Demonstrate an understanding of uniform and non-uniform linear motion, in one and two dimensions
-       distinguish between the terms constant, instantaneous, and average with reference to speed, velocity, and acceleration
-       distinguish between scalar and vector quantities as they relate to uniform and non-uniform linear motion
-       describe the characteristics and give examples of a projectile’s motion in vertical and horizontal planes
Thinking [   /8]
1: Investigate, in qualitative and quantitative terms, uniform and non-uniform linear motion, and solve related problems [       /4]
-       analyse and interpret position–time, velocity– time, and acceleration–time graphs of motion in one dimension
-       solve problems involving distance, position, and displacement
-       solve related problems using graphical analysis
-       solve related problems using algebraic equations
-       solve problems related to the motion of a projectile
2: Kinematic Labs  [       /4]
-       conduct an inquiry into the uniform and non-uniform linear motion of an object
-       plan and conduct an inquiry into the motion of objects in one dimension
-       conduct an inquiry into the projectile motion of an object
Communication [   /4]
-       Organizes ideas in a clear and logical manner
-       Communicates appropriately for audience (test vs. lab)
-       Uses appropriate terminology
-       Uses appropriate symbols
-       Uses appropriate formulae
-       Uses appropriate scientific notation
-       Uses appropriate significant digits
*Mark is averaged from all assessments
Application [   /4]
Analyse technologies that apply concepts related to kinematics, and assess the technologies’ social and environmental impact
-       analyse, on the basis of research, a technology that applies concepts related to kinematics
-       assess the impact on society and the environment of a technology that applies concepts related to kinematics
